description: Borrowed from Latin lacrimōsus, from lacrima (“tear”) + -osus (“-ful”), from Old Latin dacrima, from Proto-Indo-European *dakru-, cognate with English tear.

adjectives.description: lachrymose (comparative more lachrymose, superlative most lachrymose)

entries.meaning: Tearful, sorrowful, sad, pertaining to tears, weeping, causing tears or crying.
